intro: Melothria gilgiana, commonly known as the African sour plum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and melons. The plant produces small, yellowish-green fruits that are typically about 2–3 centimeters in diameter. The fruits are covered in a fine, white pubescence and have a tart, acidic flavor. It is often cultivated for its edible fruits and used in local cuisines.
